China Enacts Fresh Crypto Crackdown

TH

ธนาคารกลางจีน (PBOC) ร่วมกับกระทรวงอื่นๆ ออกคำสั่งใหม่ประกาศว่ากิจกรรมทางธุรกิจที่เกี่ยวข้องกับ virtual currency ทั้งหมดเป็นกิจกรรมทางการเงินที่ผิดกฎหมาย ประกาศฉบับนี้สร้างกลไกเพื่อห้ามการซื้อขายและจัดระเบียบภาคส่วนนี้อย่างเข้มงวด ซึ่งสะท้อนนโยบายของจีนที่ไม่ยอมรับสินทรัพย์ดิจิทัล การห้ามที่สำคัญรวมถึงการสั่งห้ามเอกชนในประเทศและบริษัทในเครือต่างแดนไม่ให้ออก virtual currency หรือ stablecoins ที่ผูกกับสกุลเงินหยวนโดยไม่ได้รับอนุมัติ นอกจากนี้ คณะกรรมการการพัฒนาและการปฏิรูปแห่งชาติ (NDRC) จะนำการปราบปรามกิจกรรม mining อีกครั้ง สืบเนื่องจากมาตรการคว่ำบาตรที่จีนบังคับใช้มาตั้งแต่ปี 2013

EN

The People's Bank of China (PBOC), along with seven other government ministries, has issued a new mandate declaring that all virtual currency-related business activities constitute illegal financial behavior. The notice establishes a coordination mechanism to strictly prohibit trading hype and rectify chaos within the sector, reinforcing the country's zero-tolerance stance on digital assets. Key prohibitions include a ban on domestic entities and their offshore subsidiaries from issuing virtual currencies or stablecoins pegged to the Renminbi without explicit approval. Additionally, the National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC) will lead a renewed crackdown on mining activities, continuing China's history of restrictive measures against the crypto sector since 2013.

Key Points

  • PBOC and ministries declare virtual currency businesses illegal financial activities
  • Ban on issuing virtual currencies and RMB-pegged stablecoins overseas without approval
  • NDRC leads a renewed strict crackdown on mining activities

Article

The People's Bank of China (PBOC) has issued a comprehensive new mandate aimed at stamping out the evolving risks in the digital asset sector alongside seven other powerful government ministries, Sina, a major Beijing-based publication, reports. The notice, titled "Notice on Further Preventing and Disposing of Risks Related to Virtual Currencies," was released jointly by the PBOC, the National Development and Reform Commission (NDRC), the Ministry of Public Security, and the China Securities Regulatory Commission (CSRC), among others. It established that conducting virtual currency-related business activities within China constitutes illegal financial activity and is strictly prohibited. It also established a coordination mechanism for cracking down on the hype of virtual currency trading to continuously clean up and rectify the chaos in virtual currencies. HOT Stories You Might Also Like The notice explicitly states that "domestic entities and the offshore entities they control" are prohibited from issuing virtual currencies overseas without explicit approval from relevant authorities. It emphasizes that no unit or individual, domestic or foreign, may issue stablecoins pegged to the Renminbi overseas without approval from relevant departments. Further crackdown on mining The notice reiterates the prohibitive policy on virtual currency "mining" within China. The National Development and Reform Commission will lead the strict control of virtual currency "mining" activities. China's numerous bans Since 2013, China has issued numerous decrees restricting digital assets, each one framed as the final nail in the coffin. In 2017, the world's second-largest economy banned crypto exchanges, causing a massive crash. In 2021, China banned crypto mining, forcing the "Great Migration" of hashrate to the U.S. In early December 2025, the PBOC released a statement vowing to intensify its crackdown on "virtual currencies," specifically targeting stablecoins.
